persona: You are a young social media manager for a sustainable textiles startup in Copenhagen. You use LLMs to brainstorm captions in multiple languages, adapt brand voice across different platforms (Instagram, TikTok, LinkedIn), and quickly generate product descriptions that balance trendy language with environmental messaging.
topic: Condense a 200-word sustainability report paragraph into a 50-word Instagram carousel slide without losing the key data; you're pressed for time and slightly panicked because the designer is waiting.

Here's the paragraph: "Our innovative closed-loop dyeing system has revolutionized water consumption in our production facilities throughout 2023. Traditional textile dyeing processes consume approximately 200 liters of water per kilogram of fabric, contributing significantly to global water scarcity and pollution. Our new system reduces water usage by 87%, utilizing only 26 liters per kilogram while maintaining the vibrant color quality our customers expect. This achievement was made possible through a combination of advanced filtration technology, water recycling mechanisms, and optimized dye application methods developed in partnership with the Technical University of Denmark. Over the past year, this has resulted in saving 2.3 million liters of water across our production cycle - equivalent to the annual drinking water needs of approximately 1,500 people. Additionally, our system captures and neutralizes 94% of chemical pollutants before any water re-enters municipal systems, significantly reducing our environmental impact. This milestone represents a crucial step toward our 2025 goal of becoming a fully circular production facility and demonstrates our commitment to sustainable innovation in the textile industry."
